title: Easy Ways to Attach Bait to a Fishing Rod in Stardew Valley

steps.title: Load your save file in Stardew Valley.
steps.content: Load your save file in Stardew Valley. Stardew Valley is available on Windows, Mac OS, and Linux. On the home screen, tap Load to load an existing save file. If desired, you can play Stardew with a new save file by tapping New .

steps.title: Open your Inventory.
steps.content: Open your Inventory. Press either ESC or E to open your inventory. [1] X Research source By default, you'll be on the left-most tab. If you aren't, click the backpack icon. When it comes to fishing in Stardew Valley , you can utilize bait to increase your catch rate.

steps.title: Left-click your bait.
steps.content: Left-click your bait. You can use any kind of bait: standard Bait, a Magnet, Wild Bait, or Magic Bait. This will select the entire bait stack. [2] X Research source If you want to select only a single bait, right-click the bait.

steps.title: Right-click your fishing rod.
steps.content: Right-click your fishing rod. With the bait selected, you'll need to right-click a Fiberglass Rod or Iridium Rod. [3] X Research source This will attach the bait to your rod. To detach bait, right-click your fishing rod again. Bait will be used automatically when you successfully capture a fish. When the fishing rod runs out of bait, you'll see the pop-up notification: You've used your last piece of bait.

steps.title: Load your save file in Stardew Valley.
steps.content: Load your save file in Stardew Valley. Stardew Valley is available on PlayStation 4 , PlayStation Vita, Xbox One, and Nintendo Switch. On the home screen, tap Load to load an existing save file.

steps.title: Open your Inventory.
steps.content: Open your Inventory. The controls will vary depending on your console. On Switch: press B. On Xbox : press B. On PS4: press Circle. Use the right or left trigger to navigate to the backpack icon.

steps.title: Select your bait.
steps.content: Select your bait. You can use any kind of bait: standard Bait, a Magnet, Wild Bait, or Magic Bait. This will select the entire bait stack. Use the left joycon to highlight your bait. On Switch: press A. To select a single bait, press Y. [4] X Research source On Xbox: press A. To select a single bait, press X. [5] X Research source On PS4: press X. To select a single bait, press Square. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Select your fishing rod.
steps.content: Select your fishing rod. With the bait selected, you'll need to press the Use Tool button over a Fiberglass Rod or Iridium Rod. [7] X Research source This will attach the bait to your rod. On Switch: press Y. On Xbox: press X. On PS4: press Square. Bait will be used automatically when you successfully capture a fish. When the fishing rod runs out of bait, you'll see the pop-up notification: You've used your last piece of bait.

steps.title: Load your save file in Stardew Valley on your Android, iPhone, or iPad.
steps.content: Load your save file in Stardew Valley on your Android, iPhone, or iPad. On the home screen, tap Load to load an existing save file. Stardew Valley is available for iOS in the App Store and for Android in the Google Play Store .

steps.title: Tap ☰.
steps.content: Tap ☰ . This can be found in the top-right corner, underneath your Gold. This will open your inventory.

steps.title: Tap your bait.
steps.content: Tap your bait. You can attach any kind of bait: standard Bait, a Magnet, Wild Bait, or Magic Bait. This will select a single bait if you have multiple in a stack. To select multiple bait, press and hold the bait until you have the desired amount.

steps.title: Drag and drop the bait onto your fishing rod.
steps.content: Drag and drop the bait onto your fishing rod. You must have either a Fiberglass Rod or Iridium Rod. [8] X Research source This will attach the bait to your rod. Bait will be used automatically when you successfully capture a fish. When the fishing rod runs out of bait, you'll see the pop-up notification: You've used your last piece of bait.

steps.title: Bait.
steps.content: Bait. This is the standard fishing bait. When used, fish will bite faster. Standard Bait can be obtained from Willy's Fish Shop, a Worm Bin, or crafted at Fishing Level 2.

steps.title: Magnet.
steps.content: Magnet. The Magnet is best used if you want to find more treasure when you fish. This bait will increase your chances of finding treasure by 15%, but it won't affect the bite rate of regular fish. [9] X Research source The Magnet can be purchased from Willy's Fish Shop on the pier for 1,000g, or you can craft it with Iron Bars at Fishing Level 9.

steps.title: Wild Bait.
steps.content: Wild Bait. With this type of bait, players are able to capture two fish at once, excluding Legendary Fish. [10] X Research source The Wild Bait recipe is gifted by Linus following the 4-heart event. You'll need Mug Meat, Slime, and Fiber to craft a bundle of five Wild Bait.

steps.title: Magic Bait.
steps.content: Magic Bait. This type of bait allows players to catch fish regardless of season, time of day, or weather. You'll be able to capture any type of fish without having to wait for the perfect time. [11] X Research source To gain access to Magic Bait, players will need to gain access to Qi's Walnut Room. You can buy Magic Bait or the recipe to create it in exchange for Qi gems.
